channel.title: Posts on Andrea Perfetti
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Andrea Perfetti

item.title: SLAE64 - Assignment 4 - Encoder
item.description: The fourth assigment for the SLAE64 certification asks to create a custom encoding scheme like the “Insertion Encoder” that has been presented in the course. A PoC is also requested, using execve-stack shellcode.

item.title: SLAE64 - Assignment 7 - Crypter
item.description: The seventh assignment for the SLAE64 certification asks to create a custom crypter like the one shown in the “Crypters” video. You are free to use any existing encryption schema and any programming language.

item.title: SLAE64 - Assignment 6 - Polymorphism
item.description: The sixth assigment for the SLAE64 certification asks to select 3 shellcodes from Shell-Storm and create a polymorphic version of them in order to beat pattern matching.

item.title: SLAE64 - Assignment 1 - TCP Bind Shell with passcode
item.description: The first assigment for the SLAE64 certification asks to write a TCP Bind Shell shellcode that listens on a port and then executes a shell after verifying a “passcode” on successful connection.

item.title: SLAE64 - Assignment 3 - EggHunter
item.description: The third assigment for the SLAE64 certification asks to study about the EggHunter shellcode and to create a working demo of it.

item.title: SLAE64 - Assignment 2 - TCP Reverse Shell with passcode
item.description: The second assigment for the SLAE64 certification asks to write a TCP Reverse Shell shellcode that connects to an address and a port and then executes a shell after verifying a “passcode” on successful connection.

item.title: SLAE64 - Assignment 5 - Analysis
item.description: The fifth assigment for the SLAE64 certification asks to choose 3 shellcode samples created with Msfpayload for linux/x86_64 and dissect them presenting the analysis.

item.title: SLAE32 - Assignment 3 - EggHunter
item.description: The third assigment for the SLAE32 certification asks to study about the EggHunter shellcode and to create a working demo of it (the demo should be configurable for different payloads).

item.title: SLAE32 - Assignment 1 - TCP Bind Shell
item.description: The first assigment for the SLAE32 certification asks to write a TCP Bind Shell shellcode that binds to a port and then executes a shell on the incoming connection. Requirement is that port number should be easily configurable.

item.title: SLAE32 - Assignment 2 - TCP Reverse Shell
item.description: The second assigment for the SLAE32 certification asks to write a TCP Reverse Shell shellcode that connects to an address and a port and then executes a shell on successful connection. Requirement is that IP address and port number should be easily configurable.

item.title: SLAE32 - Assignment 5 - Analysis
item.description: The fifth assigment for the SLAE32 certification asks to choose 3 shellcode samples created with Msfpayload for linux/x86 and dissect them presenting the analysis.

item.title: SLAE32 - Assignment 7 - Crypter
item.description: The seventh assignment for the SLAE32 certification asks to create a custom crypter like the one shown in the “Crypters” video. You are free to use any existing encryption schema and any programming language.

item.title: SLAE32 - Assignment 4 - Encoder
item.description: The fourth assigment for the SLAE32 certification asks to create a custom encoding scheme like the “Insertion Encoder” that has been presented in the course. a PoC is also requested, using execve-stack shellcode.

item.title: SLAE32 - Assignment 6 - Polymorphism
item.description: The sixth assigment for the SLAE32 certification asks to select 3 shellcodes from Shell-Storm and create a polymorphic version of them in order to beat pattern matching.

item.title: Hello, world!
item.description: Hello, World! This is a placeholder post. Contents will come!
